problem_text:
Suppose that H is a finite linear group over C and h is an element of H of prime order p which is not contained in any abelian normal subgroup. Is it true that h has at least (p − 1)/2 different eigenvalues?
A. E. Zalesskii
answer: Yes, it is (G. R. Robinson, J. Algebra, 178, no. 2 (1995), 635–642).
